text:

text: CBS’s soap opera “The Bold and the Beautiful” is returning to production. It's believed to be the first scripted U.S. broadcast series to return to production amid the pandemic. https://t.co/Jw6g7OSclZ

text:

name: nytimes
text: RT @andrewkeh: Sports leagues around the world are using, or plan to use, fake crowd noise on TV to mask the sounds of empty stadiums. Some fans love it and need it. Others consider it a dystopian nightmare. I wrote about this odd and very polarizing pandemic-era trend: https://t.co/6xhfkRlc5V

text: As restaurants around the U.S. look to reopen during the pandemic, local governments accelerating applications and waiving fees to allow outdoor seating. But the moves are disrupting neighborhoods and cutting much-needed tax revenue. https://t.co/fX8R81Gv4z

name: nytimes
text: After a drastic decline this spring, global greenhouse gas emissions are now rebounding sharply, scientists reported, as countries relax their coronavirus lockdowns and traffic surges back onto roads https://t.co/H7YPmD2e0q

name: nytimes
text: In early April, daily fossil fuel emissions worldwide were roughly 17% lower than they were in 2019, according to a study published in May in Nature Climate Change https://t.co/H7YPmD2e0q https://t.co/IeWokXZguG

name: nytimes
text: But by mid-June, as countries eased their lockdowns, emissions had ticked up to just 5% below the 2019 average, the authors estimated in a recent update https://t.co/H7YPmD2e0q https://t.co/gjtZj1cuNu

name: nytimes
text: This is how global CO2 emissions changed by sector during the pandemic https://t.co/H7YPmD2e0q https://t.co/z71WHKL6ZK

name: nytimes
text:
“People have no idea that I identify with them. I understand them. I’m here for them. I’ve been trying to be here as a change agent.”
For black NYPD officers, recent protests have intensified an internal tug-of-war between their identity and their badges. https://t.co/COIhpIELmu
